mods.abstract: Architectural and cultural history -- one room frame church with front and rear gables; two front doors and interior divider (women and children on left, men on right); built in 1902 by the minister, J. D. McCampbell, to replace earlier log structure
mods.note: This structure appears on the National Historical Registry.
Ownership: Federal; Current Use: Museum, with occasional use as a church
Address: Cades Cove, Great Smoky Mountains National Park, TN

subject.geographic: Cades Cove Historic District (Cades Cove, Tenn.)

titleInfo.title: Blount County Historical and Architectural Inventory
